title: quarto-hybrid-docs
text: Documentations in Python and R languages

title: Sample Python
text:
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()








Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis

title: Sample R
text:
Code
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)

# Create sample data
data <- tibble(
  x = rnorm(100),
  y = 2 * x + rnorm(100)
)

title: Sample R
text:
Code
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)

# Create sample data
data <- tibble(
  x = rnorm(100),
  y = 2 * x + rnorm(100)
)

title: Sample R
text:
Creating a Scatter Plot


Code
ggplot(data, aes(x, y)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Relationship between x and y",
    x = "Explanatory Variable",
    y = "Response Variable"
  )


`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'








Figure 1: Visualization of correlation using scatter plot
